The origin of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim originated from a blog posting on the website of The Weekly Standard, a conservative magazine. This aspect verifies the source of the claim and its credibility.
Calculation methodology: The expert's verdict explains how the $278,000-per-job cost was calculated by Jeffrey H. Anderson, who used figures from a status report on the stimulus by Obama's Council of Economic Advisers. This aspect verifies the methodology used to arrive at the claimed cost.
Evaluation by other fact: checking organizations: The expert's verdict mentions that PolitiFact Ohio and PolitiFact Texas have already examined the claim. This aspect verifies that the claim has been evaluated by multiple reputable fact-checking organizations, adding to the credibility of their findings.
Criticism and counterarguments: The expert's verdict mentions that critics argue that the stimulus package's cost of $830 billion has not resulted in a sufficient number of jobs. This aspect acknowledges the existence of counterarguments and criticism surrounding the claim, providing a balanced perspective on the issue.
